item.title: Crypto heist hacker returns most of the stolen funds
item.description: In notes sent to the blockchain, the hacker claimed to be offered a reward for returning the assets.

item.title: Lord of the Rings: Amazon moves show to UK from New Zealand
item.description: The multi-million dollar production is one of the most expensive shows in the history of television.

item.title: Lee Jae-yong: Samsung heir released from prison on parole
item.description: Critics say the move raises fresh questions about the preferential treatment of business leaders.

item.title: Google search led to arrest of cleared campaigner
item.description: An innocent housing campaigner was suspected of hacking after sharing documents he found online.

item.title: Competition watchdog says Facebook could have to sell Giphy
item.description: Facebookâ€™s merger with Giphy will harm competition between social-media platforms, the CMA says.

item.title: Activision Blizzard: Diablo 4 director and two others leave company
item.description: Three more high-profile leaders leave the gaming giant, including key staff on its latest Diablo game.

item.title: TikTok hopes to help teenagers work, rest and sleep
item.description: The network changes direct messaging and stops late-night push notifications,

item.title: Cryptocurrency heist hacker returns $260m in funds
item.description: The hacker behind the $600m Poly Network cryptocurrency heist has posted a Q&A on the blockchain.

item.title: Z Fold 3: Samsung aims to take folding phones mainstream
item.description: The electronics giant hopes lower prices and improved durability will make folding phones catch on.

item.title: Facebook removes anti-vax influencer campaign
item.description: Facebook has removed hundreds of accounts linked to a anti-vaccine campaign operated from Russia.

item.title: Instagram launches 'limits' to hide abusive messages
item.description: Instagram launches a feature to automatically hide most comments during "spikes" of abuse.

item.title: Google may cut pay of staff who work from home
item.description: The tech giant has developed a calculator that lets staff see the effects of remote working.

item.title: Instagram says sorry for removing Pedro Almodovar film poster
item.description: The advert for revered Spanish director Pedro Almodovar's new film features a lactating nipple.

item.title: Google lets parents remove children from image-search results
item.description: The search giant announces a range of changes to its children's policies on Google and YouTube.

item.title: Odeon owner AMC to accept payment in Bitcoin
item.description: Cinemagoers will be able to buy tickets and popcorn using the cryptocurrency, says the US chain.

item.title: Virtual reality: 'There's no max, there's no limit!'
item.description: "There's no max, there's no limit" to virtual reality, so is it the future of live music?

item.title: Classic Bentleys and Rolls-Royce adapted to fully electric
item.description: The vintage petrol-powered cars are re-engineered by a company based at the home of UK motorsport.

item.title: Ariana Grande sings in Fortnite's metaverse
item.description: The pop star is the latest musician to perform a series of concerts inside the hit video game.

item.title: How smart buildings could transform our experience of work
item.description: Lara Lewington visits a new smart office block to see how technology could transform working lives.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: How can new technology protect outdoor workers?
item.description: Working outdoors in extreme heat can be deadly, new tech and better protection for workers could help.

item.title: The fiendish new trick cyber-criminals are using to evade capture
item.description: Bitcoin researchers discover a new darknet tool criminals are using to help launder their digital money.

item.title: Sharing apps are booming but will the kindness continue?
item.description: The pandemic sparked a surge in activity for sharing apps like Olio but has the trend run its course?

item.title: Why artificial intelligence is being used to write adverts
item.description: Advertisers are increasingly using artificial intelligence to come up with their winning slogans.

item.title: The perfect storm striking World of Warcraft
item.description: All of a sudden, WoW players are in revolt, and its competitors are having a boom.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.
